meanings.definition: One who sacrifices or kills as a religious offering.
meanings.sent1: The immolator performed the ritual sacrifice at the temple.
meanings.sent2: The ancient immolator offered the goat to the gods.
meanings.sent3: The immolator accidentally tripped and spilled the ceremonial wine.
meanings.sent4: She was an immolator of her own desires, letting go of material possessions.
meanings.sent5: The immolator's hands trembled as they raised the blade for the sacrifice.

meanings.definition: A person who offers something as a sacrifice.
meanings.sent1: The immolator presented the fruits as an offering to the spirits.
meanings.sent2: In the legend, the immolator gave up his riches to save his village.
meanings.sent3: The immolator carefully placed the flowers on the altar, a gift to the gods.
meanings.sent4: She was the immolator of her own dreams, sacrificing them for the sake of others.
meanings.sent5: The immolator's heart swelled with devotion as they made the sacrifice.

meanings.definition: A person who kills or destroys.
meanings.sent1: The immolator of hope crushed the dreams of the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The ruthless immolator of joy left a trail of sadness in their wake.
meanings.sent3: The immolator of fun accidentally popped all the balloons at the party.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the immolator of peace, always stirring up conflict.
meanings.sent5: The immolator's gaze seemed to bring destruction wherever it fell.
